comics.transcript:
[[A ferret with airplane wings on it]]
Friend: Why on earth did you make those wings? You don't seriously think they could let your ferret fly, right?
Guy: I... of course not.
Guy: That would be pretty dumb. It's just, uh... ...a Halloween costume.
Friend: oh, okay.
Friend: Besides, who would want a pet to fly anyway?
Guy: Yeah. Pretty lame, huh?
Friend: Anyway, let's go play video games.
[[Friend leaves]]
[[Friend is gone, and Guy is looking at ferret]]
[[Guy imagines ferret flying over the ocean near the beach using his makeshift wings]]
{{title text: My brother had a ferret he loved which died since I drew this strip. RIP.}}
comics.alt: My brother had a ferret he loved which died since I drew this strip.  RIP.
comics.title: Ferret

comics.alt: Bugs are spin 1/2 particles, unless it's particularly windy.
comics.title: Standard Model Changes

comics.alt: I'm like a vampire, except I'm not crossing that threshold even if you invite me.
comics.title: COVID Risk Comfort Zone

comics.alt: 'No, my cabbage moths have already started laying eggs in them! Send the trolley into the river!' 'No, the sailing wolf will steal the boat to rescue them!'
comics.title: Boat Puzzle

comics.alt: There are some papers arguing that there's a volcanic component, but I personally think they're just feeling guilty and trying to cover the trail.
comics.title: 26-Second Pulse

comics.alt: Washington state is seeing great success with reintroducing the Columbia River Basin subpopulation. We cannot allow them to further widen the interstate bun gap.
comics.title: Rabbit Introduction

comics.alt: When my great grandfather designed the Titanic and it hit an iceberg and sank, he didn't sit around moping. He took those lessons to his next job designing airships, and he made the Hindenburg completely iceberg-proof!
comics.title: Deer Turrets

comics.alt: Someday ImageMagick will finally break for good and we'll have a long period of scrambling as we try to reassemble civilization from the rubble.
comics.title: Dependency

comics.alt: Oh no, a musician just burst in through the door confidently twirling a treble clef.
comics.title: Mathematical Symbol Fight

comics.alt: I don't see why everyone is so hungry for BAD news, but fine, I'll give in to feedback and add a dark mode.
comics.title: Exposure Notification

comics.alt: Congratulations to whoever wished for revenge on a forest near the Tunguska River, a 1980 Chevy Malibu in Peekskill NY, Alabama resident Ann Hodges, every building in Chelyabinsk with glass windows, and the non-avian dinosaurs.
comics.title: Wish on a Shooting Star

comics.alt: I vaguely and irrationally resent how useful WebPlotDigitizer is.
comics.title: Scientist Tech Help

comics.transcript:
[[ Two people stand in an aisle in a store ]]
Person 1: Nice store. How do you keep the floors so clean?
Person 2: Oh, we hired this dude named Kepler, he's really good hard worker.  Doesn't mind the monotony. Sweeps out the same area every night.
{{ alt: Science joke. You should probably just move along. }}
comics.alt: Science joke.  You should probably just move along.
comics.title: Kepler

comics.transcript:
[[Three people stand in the foyer of a restaurant. A sign above the entryway reads "JOE'S" and there is a menu next to it. In front of the entryway, there's a host behind a podium. A sign on the podium reads "EAT IN".]]
Host: Donner, party of four?
Man: Actually, never mind.
Woman: We're full.
{{title text: Some people haven't heard of the Donner Party.  They were pioneers who got stranded and likely resorted to cannibalism.}}
comics.alt: Some people haven't heard of the Donner Party.  They were pioneers who got stranded and likely resorted to cannibalism.
comics.title: Donner

comics.alt: Inflationary cosmologists call all music from after the first 10^-30 seconds "post-"
comics.title: Cosmologist Genres

comics.alt: Canada's travel restrictions on the US are 99% about keeping out COVID and 1% about keeping out people who say 'pod.'
comics.title: Pods vs Bubbles

comics.alt: I asked them if it was safe to be running tours during the pandemic. They said, "During the what?"
comics.title: Faraday Tour

comics.alt: I like trying to make it as hard as possible. "I'd love to meet up, maybe in a few days? Next week is looking pretty empty. *witchcraft"
comics.title: Asterisk Corrections

comics.alt: Oh no, my marshmallow became tidally locked!
comics.title: Campfire Habitable Zone

comics.alt: It's okay, they scan the serial numbers and make sure you can't deposit the same bill more than once.
comics.title: Photo Deposit

comics.alt: Remember the CPS 2000, the super soaker that was discontinued because it was too powerful? Relatedly, can I borrow your tuba?
comics.title: Slide Trombone

comics.alt: First prize is a free ticket to the kissing booth.
comics.title: COVID Risk Chart

comics.alt: The Wirecutter staff called the Herman Miller Siege Perilous "the most cursed product we've ever had to fight" and "nearly as immortal as it boasts."
comics.title: Cursed Chair

comics.transcript:
[[A boy sits in a barrel which is floating in an ocean.]]
Boy: I wonder where I'll float next?
[[The barrel drifts into the distance. Nothing else can be seen.]]
{{Alt: Don't we all.}}
comics.alt: Don't we all.
comics.title: Barrel - Part 1

comics.alt: The worst is being teased by responsible, mask-wearing teens. They even spritz the hamster ball with disinfectant before rolling it, carefully avoiding the filter vents.
comics.title: Hamster Ball 2

comics.alt: Good thing I'm not already prone to overthinking everyday decisions!
comics.title: Acceptable Risk

comics.alt: There are plenty of finer gradations. I got 'critically endangered/extinct in the wild' on my exam, although the curve bumped it all the way up to 'venti.'
comics.title: Universal Rating Scale

comics.alt: My shooting will improve over the short term, but over the long term the universe will take more shots.
comics.title: Space Basketball

comics.alt: We're underwater on our mortgage thanks to the low price of water.
comics.title: Oily House Index

comics.alt: My other (much harder) hobby is trying to engineer situations where I have an excuse to use more than one of them in short succession.
comics.title: Five Word Jargon

comics.alt: My biggest fear is that colonial engineers will try to flood me to generate electricity. My biggest hope is that I'll develop sailing stones.
comics.title: Endorheic Basin

comics.alt: The git vehicle fleet eventually pivoted to selling ice cream, but some holdovers remain. If you flag down an ice cream truck and hand the driver a floppy disk, a few hours later you'll get an invite to a git repo.
comics.title: Old Days 2

comics.alt: You've got questions, we've got assumptions.
comics.title: Modeling Study

comics.alt: The ISO 216 standard ratio is cos(45Â°), but American letter paper is 8.5x11 because it uses radians, and 8.5/11 = pi/4.
comics.title: ISO Paper Size Golden Spiral

comics.alt: The worst part is that's the millisigma interval.
comics.title: Confidence Interval
